Today, Dan and Jordan celebrate Alex's return from his little breaky. In this installment, [[Harrison Smith]] loves St. Patrick's Day, Alex falls victim to weaponized weed, and many pro-Putin talking points fly freely.

==Detailed Show Notes==

Topics covered<ref>[https://knowledgefight.com/research/2022/3/20/episode-661-march-17-2022 Episode #661: March 17, 2022]</ref>:

*Harrison Smith has some weird ideas about St. Patrick, which are [https://www.history.com/topics/st-patricks-day/who-was-saint-patrick not true]
*Alex returns from California, where he apparently did a podcast and interviewed Mike Tyson
*Alex got high in CA, and may still be high two days later
*[https://news.yahoo.com/exclusive-secret-cia-training-program-in-ukraine-helped-kyiv-prepare-for-russian-invasion-090052743.html CIA training in Ukraine] after the annexation of Crimea
*Seeds [https://www.thespruce.com/how-long-do-vegetable-seeds-last-1403089 do not live forever]
*Alex appears to have gotten his news about Ukraine from the website Information Liberation, which publishes headlines like this

[[File:https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/58bc3c86b8a79bbdc67b182c/f4075b8e-e8ef-4768-b7e9-b14abddde89c/funny.JPG|thumb|none]]

*[[Francis Boyle]] comes by to talk about how the Ukrainian bioweapon lab conspiracy is true
*Boyle brings up [https://mid.ru/ru/foreign_policy/rso/nato/1790803/?lang=en a December treaty proposal from Putin], which he leaves out some details of
*[https://www.cvce.eu/en/obj/founding_act_on_mutual_relations_cooperation_and_security_between_nato_and_the_russian_federation_paris_27_may_1997-en-88261581-c579-46da-b95d-acbbcc4b57a5.html The 1997 agreement] between NATO and Russia
*Alex and Boyle seem to think a nuclear treaty expired prior to the war beginning, but [https://www.state.gov/new-start/ New Start] actually had already been [https://www.armscontrol.org/act/2021-03/news/us-russia-extend-new-start-five-years extended until 2026]
